reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Save the Children Finland Global Programme 2022-25

description.narrative: Save the Children Finland?s (SCF) Global Programme 2022-25 aims to improve children?s and families access to services; the overall wellbeing and protection of children and child and gender sensitivity of services systems policies and programmes to ensure a safe and conducive environment for all children to grow and develop to their full potential. Programme builds mainly on two themes: child protection and child poverty. Child protection looks into both formal and informal high quality child protection serv ices and violence free environment child poverty focuses on vulnerable and poor populations? access to social protection services and improved child development outcomes within households receiving social protection. The primary focus is on reaching the mo st deprived children in fragile context; five out of the seven countries selected to receive MFA programme funding are in sub-Saharan Africa and five out of seven countries have LDC status. Four out of the seven countries are in fragile context.Special foc us is given to gender equality disability inclusion and climate change adaptation. SCF has developed tools to incorporate these cross-cutting objectives in individual projects. SCF supports the localisation agenda by strengthening the civil society and pro moting partnerships with local CSO?s as well as government institutions. Participation child participation in particular is fundamental to the way SC works and guaranteed by strong accountability and transparency mechanisms.SCF?s Global Programme 2022-25 i s based on the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child (UNCRC) and SCF follows a rights-based approach Child Rights Programming. SCF?s human rights programming is transformative. Programme is in line with Finland?s Development Policy and Finland?s Countr y Programmes 2021-24 where feasible SDGs and Agenda 2030 and Paris Agreement on climate.SCF will also invest in the involvement of the private sector in development co-operation and private sector activities by promoting child rights and business principle s through liaising with corporates. Advocacy and communications form integral parts of the Programme implementation.

tag.narrative: Improving democracy in societies is a secondary priority area in this activity
